snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron championed the measure, but faced a major rebellion by lawmakers in his party.
abstract: British House of Commons votes overwhelmingly to approve bill legalizing same-sex marriage, indicating that bill is assured of passages as it moves through further legislative stages; Prime Min David Cameron champions measure but faces rebellion by lawmakers in his party, over half of whom voted against measure or abstained.

byline.original: By JOHN F. BURNS and ALAN COWELL

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron championed the measure, but faced a major rebellion by lawmakers in his party.

headline.seo: House of Commons Approves Same-Sex Marriage
headline.main: British House of Commons Approves Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: British Lawmakers Vote for Gay Marriage Despite Conservative Split

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
